question: What is Azure?
answer:
Azure is a flexible and open cloud platform that enables you to quickly build, deploy, and manage applications in your data center. Azure supports all major operating systems, languages, or development tools and integrates public cloud applications with the existing IT infrastructure.

Azure offers international standard Service Level Agreements that enable you to build and run highly available applications without having to focus on the infrastructure. It provides the ability to automatically repair operating systems and services and has built-in network load balancing and hardware error recovering capabilities. It supports the deployment models that allow you to upgrade applications with no downtime.

Azure enables you to generate applications in any language and by any framework or tool; Azure utilizes the public functions and services of open REST protocol. Azure’s client libraries are available in a variety of programming languages, are published under open source licenses and hosted on GitHub.

Azure offers a flexible cloud platform that meets the needs of any application.

question: What are the prices of Azure services in China?
Are Azure services in China the same as Azure services in other areas?
answer: In China, Azure is operated by Shanghai Blue Cloud Technology Co., Ltd., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Beijing 21Vianet Broadband Data Center Co., Ltd. (abbreviated as “21Vianet”). 21Vianet is China’s largest neutral third-party Internet infrastructure service telecommunications provider to which Microsoft has authorized technologies. In China, Azure combines Microsoft’s global technologies and 21Vianet’s local operating experience to build an enterprise-level international cloud computing platform for China. Outside China, Microsoft Azure is operated by Microsoft itself. China’s Azure customers will be able to enjoy entirely the same user experiences and service level as customers in other areas.

question: What is an SLA (Service Level Agreement)? What kind of SLA does Azure offer in China?
answer: We provide international class Service Level Agreements for each of the official and commercial Azure services. If the corresponding service level is not reached, the customer can enjoy the corresponding service fee deduction. Details on SLAs provided by Azure in China are listed at: Service Level Agreements.

question: Any examples of success stories of Azure in China?
answer: In China, a large number of enterprises like GMW.cn, Linekong, Spring Airlines, Mobike, Digital China, Coca Cola, Kingdee, PPTV, ChinaCache, and Qoros have landed onto the Azure platform in China. Please go to the Success Stories page for more information on these cases.

question: How are Virtual Machines charged? Why does my virtual machine still incur costs when it’s closed?
answer: Virtual Machines billing is divided into two parts: the cost of the virtual machine itself and the cost produced by the disk (divided into hosting disk and non-hosting disk), so as long as your virtual machine and the disk are not deleted, this part of the disk storage cost always exists. Please refer to the Price Details of Disk Storage for billing standards. In addition, you should note that two virtual machine statuses “Suspended” and “Suspended (de-allocated)” are charged differently. Please refer to the following table:

question: How do I select among Azure computing services: Web Apps, Cloud Services or Virtual Machines? If I’m an enterprise user, which service should I select to migrate the existing enterprise applications to the Azure cloud computing platform when provided with these three different computing capabilities?
answer: According to the following characteristics, you can select the service that is suitable for your needs:

question: How can Azure services in China ensure the security of users’ data and services?
answer: The security and stability of Cloud Services have always been the focus of the industry. As the first international public cloud service landed in China, Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet has gained recognition from many industry users, and provided users with reliable, flexible and highly valuable public Cloud Services. In full compliance with China’s policies and regulations, Azure data service in China provides up to six geo-redundant backups, distributed in 2 data centers (China North and China East). In addition, with decades of experience in providing enterprise customers with online services which are applied in the Azure platform, we strive to keep the leading position in the industry in terms of security, privacy and control and compliance practices. For more details, see the Data Security, Privacy and FAQ pages in the Azure Trust Center.

question: I have an MSDN subscription, and when I enable “Azure Benefit” for my account, is this service also available in Azure China?
answer: No. China's Azure service is operated by 21Vianet. The Azure Benefit in your account can only be operated on platforms in other areas of Azure. MSDN accounts cannot be enabled on Azure China's platform operated by 21Vianet. If you're interested in applying for one of the Microsoft Azure services operated by 21Vianet, please fill out the Azure Trial Application Form to experience Azure with the 1RMB Trial plan.

question: Does Azure support open-source software in China?
answer: Azure supports a large number of open source applications, frameworks and languages, and the number is still growing. We understand that developers want to use the most suitable tools based on their own experience, skill, tool and application needs, and our goal is to allow developers to choose tools as needed. For open source code, please refer to Microsoft Azure SDK.

question: What kind of roles does Microsoft play in Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet?
answer: Microsoft Azure in China is a public cloud platform that is operated and sold independently by 21Vianet on the Chinese mainland. Based on Microsoft's decades of rich online service experience in global enterprise customers, Azure, a world-class technology, has been developed to fully serve China's customers, so as to provide a consistent service quality guarantee for our customers all over the world.

question: Where can I find details on the new features?
answer: You can find the details of the new features through the Latest Announcements.

question: How will 21Vianet use the information I stored in Azure?
answer: 21Vianet will only use your customer data stored in Azure to provide you with Azure services. These services may include the troubleshooting for preventing, detecting, or fixing issues that affect the operation of Azure and the improvement of features that detect and resist emerging and evolving threats to users (such as malicious software and junk mail). As per 21Vianet policy, in addition to providing you with cloud productivity services, we will never mine or use your customer’s data for advertising purposes. If you want to know more about our promise regarding your data, please go to the Privacy and FAQ pages in the Azure Trust Center.

question: I want to learn more about Azure. In addition to the Starter Guide, do you have any further study materials?
answer: You can browse the Documentation Center. This page contains links and the following content: Publish and search questions in the Azure Forum. Browse the Azure School for related Azure courses and expert columns.

question: What is the 1RMB Trial subscription?
answer: This is a promotional activity launched by the Microsoft Azure and operated by 21Vianet. You can sign up online and pay ￥ 1 to activate your 1RMB Trial subscription and get ￥ 1,500 in Azure service credits that are valid for one month.

question: What is the standard Pay-in-Advance (PIA) subscription? What are the characteristics of such subscription?
answer: Standard Pay-in-Advance (PIA) subscription needs to be purchased by Pay-in-Advance. The balance will be deducted according to the actual usage of the user, and overuse is not supported. When the balance is 0, the service will be stopped immediately, and recharge is required to continue using. The minimum prepayment amount of standard Pay-in-Advance (PIA) subscription is ￥ 1,000 with online payment, and ￥ 5,000 with Wire Transfer, which is valid for 12 months after each recharge.

question: Can I apply and sign up for more than one 1RMB Trial Subscription?
answer: No. In order to allow more customers to experience Azure services, each new customer has only one opportunity to enjoy this promotion, and only one purchase can be made for the same identification card and the same paid account. If you need more than one subscription, or your 1RMB Trial subscription has expired, please use the Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription.

question: What should I do when a phone validation problem is met while signing up for the 1RMB Trial?
answer: If you have applied for the 1RMB Trial subscription with your mobile phone number and passed verification via the mobile phone, and you did not complete the entire sign up process before quitting, then you may not be able to apply again with the same phone number. If you encounter such problems, try using another mobile phone number to revalidate, or you can contact the 21Vianet support team for help.

question: Do I have to provide identification card information to complete the registration?
answer: Yes, in order to comply with the requirements of relevant laws and regulations and ensure the safety of each subscriber’s account, each registered user needs to provide personal identity information for real-name system certification, so as to obtain secure Azure service.

question: What is Organization, OrganizationID and Account?
answer:
An enterprise can also sign up multiple organizations in Azure AD, e.g. different departments are registered as different organizations.

Multiple enterprises can also jointly sign up in Azure AD as an organization for a collaborative project.

Currently, the domain available for sign up is *.partner.onmschina.cn. The * represents the user’s registered name, which is the unique identifier of the organization registered in Azure AD by the user.

If the customer’s registered organization domain name is contoso.partner.onmschina.cn, you can create an account for ABC in the organization: ABC@contoso.partner.onmschina.cn.

question: I have an Office 365 account. Can I use the account information for Azure subscription registration?
answer: Yes. If you have already bought Office 365 products and want to use the same account to manage Office 365 and Azure services at the same time, please refer to purchasing an Azure subscription via an Office 365 account.

question: After creating the account, if the whole signup process is not completed, how can I get back to the previous account and continue sign up?
answer: You may sign into Azure portal or Azure account center with the account you created earlier, and you may see either of two prompts: 1. When you see the yellow bar reminder that “Your XXXX is waiting for payment”, select the yellow Pay for the Suspended Subscription bar below to continue to pay Note: Using the UnionPay Online payment, after the order is submitted, the payment should be completed within 15 minutes. If the payment time is over 15 minutes, the payment may not be successfully done and the order should be resubmitted. 2. If you see the message that “No subscription has been found” or “It appears that you haven't created a subscription,” you can refer to tips for “No subscription has been found” in the Azure portal or the Azure Account Center for help.

question: When signing up for an Azure account, why do I see Sorry! The 1RMB Trial subscription/Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA service is not available. You are not eligible for this specific Promo product/service?
answer: This prompt indicates that the activation code of your registered Azure account is expired and needs to be re-applied. Please refer to the 1RMB Trial subscription signup for the specific application process.

question: When an Azure account is registered, the payment information cannot be loaded or the payment information is not received during the payment stage.
answer: If this problem occurs, the possible reason is that your browser does not support third-party Cookies, and you can refer to “Azure online sign up FAQ” for more help.

question: When applying for the 1RMB Trial subscription, why is there a message showing that payment was successful, but when I return to the Azure registration page, I still see a payment failure message?
answer: Each new customer can only enjoy this trial offer once, so one paid account (including UnionPay and Alipay accounts) can only be used to apply for the 1RMB Trial once. If you use a payment account that has successfully applied for the trial subscription to apply again and pay ￥ 1, the aforementioned problem will occur, namely: the subscription page shows that payment is complete, but the Azure sign up page shows that payment has failed. The refund system will automatically return the money to the paid account for the ￥ 1 transaction. The specific refund time will be different due to the different operations of each bank and bank card. If you need more than one subscription, or have tried the 1RMB Trial subscription, please refer to the Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA Subscription.

question: When does the one-month validity of the 1RMB Trial subscription start?
answer: Validity starts from successful payment and lasts one month.

question: In the one-month validity period of the 1RMB Trial subscription, can the subscription be converted into a standard Pay-in-Advance subscription? How do I do this?
answer: Yes. You can upgrade the subscription to the Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription at any time during the validity of the 1RMB Trial. You can click "Upgrade now" at the Azure Account Center and recharge at least ￥ 1,000 to your account to turn it into a Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription. Please refer to 1RMB Trial subscription upgrade detailed procedures.

question: How should I monitor the balance and the period of validity, in order to avoid any inconvenience caused by the cease of service?
answer: During the service period for Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet, you will receive a reminder email of the balance and expiration in your contact email every week. You can also sign into the Azure account center to check the balance and the validity at any time. It is recommended that you make an assessment based on the actual usage and reserve a sufficient balance.

question: Is payment by wire transfer supported? What should I do?
answer: Not supported. The 1RMB Trial subscription only supports Alipay and UnionPay online payment methods. Supported. The Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription supports three payment methods, i.e. Alipay, UnionPay and online payment and wire transfer. The minimum payment amount of the first two online payment methods is ¥ 1,000, the lowest payment amount of wire transfer is ¥ 5,000. Please refer to the wire transfer instructions for detailed wire transfer operations.

question: Can I use foreign currency for remittance when I choose to pay by wire transfer for my Azure subscription account?
answer: Only the Chinese ￥  is accepted as the payment currency for Azure's service in China.

question: What should I do if I cannot complete the full subscription ID due to the bank’s limits?
answer: You can send the following remittance information to azure_invoice@oe.21vianet.com, so that we can distinguish the remittance sources and recharge your subscription in a timely manner.

question: How can I upgrade the 1RMB Trial to a Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription, or recharge a Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription?
answer: The Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription supports three payment methods, i.e. Alipay, UnionPay and Online Payment and wire transfer, and each payment method has the minimum recharge amount. If you select "Alipay" or "UnionPay Online" and other methods of online remittance, after clicking on "Upgrade" or "Recharge", enter the recharge amount according to the prompt (the minimum amount is ￥ 1,000, and the maximum amount is ￥ 150,000), and then click on the check mark. The payment page will appear and you should follow the instructions to complete the payment. If you select wire transfer, the minimum recharge amount should be ￥ 5,000. Please refer to recharging Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscriptions for details. Note: Microsoft Azure services currently operated by 21Vianet only accepts payments in ￥ .

question: How to download and analyze the monthly usage report?
answer: Users purchasing online (including 1RMB Trials and Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscriptions) The usage report can be obtained via the platform, including the monthly consumption summary, billing amount and daily consumption of each service. This operation is restricted to the account managers who purchase subscriptions online. For detailed steps, please refer to Downloading monthly usage reports for online purchasers. The monthly usage report is presented in Excel format, which consists of three parts: * Subscription and account validity information * Monthly service usage and billing information * Daily service usage Refer to Understanding monthly usage reports for details. Enterprise Agreement User You can sign into the Enterprise Portal to view the historic usage and current remaining amount in the contract. The usage in the system can be delayed for up to 5 days, and you can see the details by date through the Download Usage feature. The Enterprise Portal provides customers with three viewing methods: monthly report downloading, Premium report downloading and API access key. The monthly report and advanced report provide the service content, service amount and the corresponding billing amount consumed in each department, account and subscription every day up to the date of the report. Please refer to Downloading usage reports for Enterprise Agreement users for details. The monthly usage report is presented in CSV format, which provides each account and the corresponding usage information every day, including usage and the corresponding costs. Please refer to Understanding Monthly Usage Reports for details. In order to help you better use Azure and boost your cloud business, Azure provides you with informative training tutorials. You can refer to the Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA billing portal training at the Azure Video Center to understand the specific operations for creating pivot tables through bills.

question: How are the remaining days and remaining credits viewed?
Under what circumstances will my subscription be suspended? How can I reactivate it?
answer: When the remaining usage of your subscription is 0 or when the usage credits expire, your subscription will be disabled. You need to recharge it within 15 days and upgrade the subscription to the Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription, and then you may continue to use this subscription. When the remaining usage of your subscription is 0 or when the usage is expired, your subscription will be disabled. You need to recharge it within 90 days to resume this subscription. * When the excessive amount or annual order is not paid, your subscription will be disabled. After you finish the payment, the business team will help you manually restart the contract and subscription. * When your subscription is unexpectedly canceled by the account owner, you need to contact the 21Vianet support staff to help you manually restart it. If the subscription is disabled for other reasons, please contact the 21Vianet support team for help.

question: What will happen to me after my subscription is disabled? Will my data be preserved? Can I take out the data in my subscription?
answer: When your subscription is disabled, the resource services deployed in the subscription will be disabled and the resources in temporary storage will be released. You can still sign into the portal to view the resources, but you can't edit them. The data in your subscription will be preserved, but at the time, the data cannot be backed up. The data can be exported only after the subscription is reactivated. If it is not recharged within the specified period, your subscription and all the data in the subscription will be automatically deleted. * After the 1RMB Trial subscription is suspended, your data will be kept for 15 days, and if you recharge it within 15 days, the subscription can be resumed. * After the Standard Pay-in-Advance PIA subscription is suspended, your data will be kept for 90 days, and if you recharge it within 90 days, the subscription can be resumed. * After the Enterprise Agreement subscription is suspended, your data will be kept for 90 days, and you need to pay for the excess amount and annual order within 90 days. You can contact 21Vianet customer support to help you restart the subscription.

question: What are the payment methods for my subscription? Can I change after the selection?
answer:
* New purchase: The two online payment methods of Alipay and UnionPay Online are supported, and the payment method cannot be changed before the recharge order fails.

* Upgrade now: The three online payment methods of Alipay, UnionPay Online and wire transfer are supported, and the payment method cannot be changed before the recharge order fails.

* New purchase: The three online payment methods of Alipay, UnionPay Online and wire transfer are supported, and the payment method cannot be changed before the recharge order fails.

* Recharge: The three online payment methods of Alipay, Unionpay Online and wire transfer are supported, and the payment method can be changed at any time.

question: How can I deal with an interruption in the process of using Alipay or UnionPay Online when purchasing a standard Pay-in-Advance account?
answer: Sign into Azure Account Center and click the yellow bar on the underside of the subscription to continue to pay. Note: Using the UnionPay Online payment, after the order is submitted, the payment should be completed within 15 minutes. If the payment time is over 15 minutes, the payment may not be successfully done and the order should be resubmitted.

question: How can I get my unpaid order? How long is the valid period of the order?
answer: Alipay orders are valid for 3 days. If you fail to complete the payment in time during the payment process, you can see the relevant prompt in the Azure Account Center within 3 days: "Your ￥ 1,000.00 payment is waiting to be completed. If you have already completed the payment, please check it later. Click here to complete payment before XX/XX/XXXX." Click this prompt to continue your payment. Alipay orders cannot be canceled manually. The system will automatically cancel them three days later. UnionPay online orders generally expire within 1 hour, after which the Azure Account Center will give you the prompt: “Recharge on your subscription failed. Please click here to try again”. At this point, you can make the payment again and change the payment method. Wire transfer orders shall be valid for 7 working days. If the payment is not completed within 7 working days, the wire transfer order will be cancelled on the back-end. If you need to cancel the wire transfer order, you need to contact the 21Vianet service hotline at 400-089-0365. Please refer to the Introduction to Wire Transfers for operation steps and remittance information.

question: What should I do if I enter the wrong account/amount when I make a payment, and the payment is not completed?
Can the monthly usage report detail the cost of each Azure service I create (for example, a single virtual machine)?
answer:
No, the billing information in the Monthly Usage Report will be aggregated according to the Azure service and related types and specifications, so you cannot accurately query the individual charge for each Azure service.

Take the virtual machine as an example: if you have created multiple virtual machines of the same size and model, the billing information thereof will be displayed in a row in the monthly usage report. The “Consumed” column accumulates the usage of multiple virtual machines for billing.

question: What is a Fapiao? What is the specific process for requesting a Fapiao? What types of Fapiao are there? Are Fapiao headers limited?
answer: Fapiaos are official receipts (provided by the seller) issued by the State Administration of Taxation for the purchase of domestic goods or services. The Chinese government uses Fapiaos to track tax payments. 1. Sign in to the Azure Account Center. 2. Click on the subscription you need to request a Fapiao for. 3. Click on Payment History. 4. Click on Manage Fapiao to register and make a request. Please see Applying for Chinese Tax Fapiaos for the detailed request process. The Azure service in China can provide Chinese tax Fapiaos, including VAT special Fapiaos and VAT ordinary Fapiaos. For the Fapiao title, enterprise customers should fill in information according to the actual situation.

question: After applying for a Fapiao, how do I get the Fapiao? Do I have to pay any extra costs?
answer:
The Fapiao can be sent by express delivery or obtained by yourself. It is printed and delivered by 21Vianet Shanghai Blue Cloud Technology Co., Ltd, and you can select Yunda Express or SF Express (for freight collect payment only).

Except for the above-mentioned freight payment collected by SF Express, you do not need to pay any extra fees.

question: When can I apply for a Fapiao?
answer: You can apply for a Fapiao within 3 working days after the payment is successfully completed. Should you have any special requirements, please contact the 21Vianet Customer Service Center at 86-10-84563652 or 400-089-0365.

question: What is the tax rate?
answer: According to relevant Chinese regulations, the tax rate for Azure Cloud Computing Services operated by 21Vianet is 6%.

question: How do I sign in to a Fapiao account? What should I do if I can’t apply Fapiao after activating Fapiao account successfully? What should I do if I can’t apply for Fapiao?
answer: After entering the Fapiao Application Interface, you can click “Sign Up Account” in the right corner of the page and choose the product you’ve purchased to sign up for an Azure account. If you are unable to apply for Fapiao after activating Fapiao account successfully, please call 21Vianet Customer Service Center: 86-10-84563652 or 400-089-0365.

question: When applying for a Fapiao, I chose to obtain the Fapiao by myself. What address can I pick it up at? Can I still change to express delivery?
answer: The self-pickup address is 21Vianet Shanghai Branch, located at Building 3, Room 657, German Centre, No.88 Keyuan Road, Pudong District, Shanghai. You can contact Zhu Qinqin at 021-28986102. You can sign into the Fapiao Management System at any time to modify the delivery method of your Fapiao. For now, you can only select Yunda Express or SF Express (for freight collect payment only).

question: How can I modify the registered mailbox in the Fapiao Management System?
answer: Click the mailbox at the upper right corner of the Fapiao Management System, and select Modify Email Address via the drop-down menu to enter your current password and new email and confirm the same. Then you can modify your email with a click. After the modification is completed, two emails will be sent to your two mailboxes, respectively, for notification.

question: What can I do if I cannot receive an activation email when signing up for an Fapiao Management System account?
Can I change the subscription name?
answer: Yes, you can use the Azure Account Center or Azure portal to rename your subscription. For detailed steps, please refer to the Changing Subscription Names and Account Contacts Link.

question: Can I change the service administrator?
answer: Yes. You need to establish new user’s information in the Azure portal first, and then change the role of the service administrator through the Azure Account Center, referring to How to Set the Service Administrator for specific steps.

question: How to establish the subscription user’s role and authorize different management limits for users?
answer: There are three roles including the owner, contributor and reader under the Azure Account, and the roles are applicable to all resources. As the administrator of the account, you can distribute different roles to the business personnel in your company in accordance with the business requirements of your company. Please refer to Add or Alter the Role of the Azure Administrator Managing the Subscription or Service for specific steps.

question: How many roles does the Azure Account have?
Can I alter the Profile of the Account Administrator?
answer: Yes. You can alter the Profile of the Account Administrator through the Azure Account Center, referring to Change Account Subscription Name and Contact Method for specific steps.

question: How to view the current Azure quota and its service conditions?
answer: The Azure portal, Cloud Assistant APP and PowerShell all provide the service conditions of the Azure quota resources. Refer to How to View Azure Quota Resources for specific steps.

question: Can I apply for the Azure quota resources? And how can I apply for it?
answer: Yes. You can contact the 21Vianet support team to submit a service request. Please refer to How to Apply for Azure Quota Resources for details. Note: if your quota demand is quite large and urgent, we recommend that you apply for it at least three working days in advance.

question: During the maintenance period, how long will a single IaaS virtual machine or single PaaS role instance stays offline?
If my virtual machine is impacted for a relatively short time, can I define the maintenance time point on my own?
Can I opt to have my virtual machine exit this maintenance?
What measures should I take to reduce the impact and risk caused by this maintenance on running applications?
Why can’t I access the VIP IP address and port of Azure VM from the local Ping?
answer: When accessing a virtual machine via a VIP address, network communication needs to be through Azure Load Balancer. Azure Load Balancer currently does not open the ICMP protocol. Ping belongs to the ICMP protocol group and cannot access the Load Balancer. When customers need to verify the connectivity of virtual machines via VIP, they can operate with tools related to the TCP Protocol, referring to Using the PsPing & PaPing for TCP port connectivity testing.

question: Can I create a virtual machine in Azure Virtual Machines?
answer: No, you cannot create it at present. The Dv3 and Ev3 series of the Azure Virtual Machines support nested virtualization, but as of now, Azure in China temporarily does not support creating virtual machines of this series.

question: Can I create a Windows Server 2003 virtual machine in Azure?
answer:
The officially supported Windows Server virtual machine template is:

Customers can use local Hyper-V to create a virtual machine template for Server 2003 to Azure cloud, but there’s no way to get Microsoft’s official support if there’s a problem with the virtual machine.

question: Is it supported to deploy Microsoft Exchange,Skype and Sharepoint in Azure?
answer: The SharePoint virtual machine templates can be selected from Azure Virtual Machines templates and can be officially supported by Microsoft. Exchange Server and Lync Server can be customized and uploaded, but not officially supported.

question: What is the load balancing mechanism?
answer: Azure Load Balancer is based on the fourth level (TCP, UDP), enabling distribution of incoming traffic to the well-operated service instances defined in a load-balancing set, so as to improve the availability and network performance of applications. Azure Load Balancer can be configured: For more details about Azure Load Balancer, please refer to Overview of the Azure Load Balancer.

question: How do I perform data backup?
answer:
The Azure backup provides two types of copies: Locally Redundant Storage (LRS) and Geo-Redundant Storage (GRS). Locally Redundant Storage copies the data in the matching data center of the same region three times (creating three data copies). Geo-Redundant Storage copies the data to the secondary region several kilometers from the primary location of the source data. In order to prevent temporary storage unavailability arising from a disaster in one region, we recommend that customers copy data by way of reading and accessing Read-access Redundant Storage (RA-GRS). This way, in case of unavailability of the storage account of the primary region, the data can be accessed from the secondary region.

The following table describes the backup of all kinds of data services in the Azure, disaster recovery capabilities and backup methods:

question: Can I choose the regions (China East, China North) of its VIP addresses when creating related services (Cloud Computing)?
answer: The VIP address is determined in accordance with the selected region (China North, China East) of the customer when creating related services and is randomly distributed from the IP address pool managed by Microsoft. For instance, if the customers choose China North, they will be preferentially distributed within the IP address in Northern China.

question: What should I pay attention to when running a business application with a virtual machine?
answer: Azure will regularly update the environment of the host to ensure that all the operating applications and virtual machines in the platform are always in a secure environment. This updating process may restart your virtual machines. Restarting of the virtual machine will cause the operating applications in the virtual machine to go offline. The data may be lost when the virtual machine is migrated. Some reasons for virtual machine migration are as follows: In order to guarantee high availability of the applications/services hosted in the Azure Virtual Machine, we recommend: 1. Using multiple virtual machines during concentration of availability set. 2. Making all components (front-end interface/application logic/data storage and so on) of applications be of a high-availability structure, and make each component be deployed in multiple Virtual Machines with availability, where each Virtual Machine involved in the applications deployment going offline shall not cause the entire system to go offline. 3. After the business-critical applications are deployed to the Azure Virtual Machines, the application is thoroughly tested for the potential impact of virtual machine restarts. For more information, please refer to the following link: Manage Availability of the Windows virtual machine in the Azure Why was the Azure VM restarted? Service Level Agreement

question: Is there anything to note about using virtual machines to store application data?
answer: Azure Virtual Machine disk contains a temporary disk, the D: disk (Windows) or /dev/sdb1 (Linux). They only provide temporary storage, so there is a risk of data loss, and the data cannot be completely recovered under some conditions. It is recommended that the disk not be used to store data long term. The user must bear the risk of data resulting from this. Loss of temporary disk data usually occurs when virtual machines are migrated to different host machines. The reasons for virtual machine migration include: adjustment of virtual machine size, updating the host machine, or a failure in host machine hardware. The time of virtual machine migrating cannot be predicted, and it may occur when the user does not conduct any operation. Therefore, we recommend that the disk not be used to store data long term. For more information on virtual machine disks and the high availability of virtual machines, refer to the following links: About disk storage of the Azure Windows VM Manage Availability of the Windows virtual machine in the Azure Why was the Azure VM restarted? Service Level Agreement

question: How do I add the virtual machine to the virtual network? What is the difference between the virtual machine network adding the virtual machine and the network not building the virtual machine? And how do I put an existing virtual machine into a new virtual network?
answer: First, create a virtual network, then select the previously-created virtual network when creating the virtual machine, and add the virtual machine to the virtual network. For specific steps, please refer to How to Add the Virtual Machines to the Virtual Network. After the virtual machine is put into the Virtual Network, it’s ensured that the virtual machines can communicate with each other via internal networks, and the Premium functions, for instance P2S S2S VPN, can be configured. If a virtual machine is not added to the virtual network during construction, it cannot be added to a virtual network later. Currently, this kind of virtual machine only can be deleted (saving the disk for storing data), and a new virtual machine will be established by using the saved data disk, and choose to join an existing virtual network when creating this virtual machine.

question: What are the supported versions of customized Windows OS and Linux OS?
answer: For details, please refer to: Create the Windows VM from a Dedicated Disk and Linux Release Versions Accepted by Azure.

question: List of validated local network VPN devices that are compatible with Azure Site to Site VPN
answer: Please refer to Site to Site VPN for details.

question: How to configure websites deployed in Azure virtual machine to be accessible from public networks?
answer: By default, Azure virtual machines only open limited ports corresponding to its VIP, used for remote connection or management. If a newly built website needs to be accessed via a certain port of a VIP, it is required to add an Endpoint to this virtual machine. This operation can be completed through Azure portal or Powershell.

question: What is the availability set? And how do I apply the availability set to increase the availability of applications?
answer: The availability set is a kind of logical grouping function. Applying it in Azure can ensure that the VM resources can be mutually isolated after they are deployed in Azure Data Center. Azure can ensure that the VM deployed in the availability set can operate across multiple physical servers, computer racks, storage units and network switches. In case of failure of the hardware or Azure software, the VM and application will be updated, thus only part of the VM will be affected and the whole application can maintain operations for the customer. For more details, please refer to Azure IaaS Manual and How to use the Availability Set.

question: How about the security of the Azure Storage service?
answer:
The Azure Storage service will allocate two access keys to the user: the primary and secondary access keys. This access key is a character string with 256 bytes, and the user can use it to verify every data access request for Azure Storage services.

Two access keys have the same function of being able to access data. The setting of two access keys is to help the user switch access keys. For instance, usually, the user will use the primary access key, and if the primary access key is revealed, the user can make the primary access key invalid in the shortest time (a new primary access key will be generated) and then switch over to the secondary access key. Meanwhile, the user does not have to alter the code, and just needs to alter the service configuration file, and there is also no downtime for simultaneously updating the service configuration file. Moreover, another effective way is that the application code can use the primary access key to access data, and if verification fails, the code will automatically use the secondary access key. In this way, there will be no downtime when the user changers switches access keys.

In order to further increase flexibility of Access Control for Blob data, another data Access Control method is provided by the Azure Data Storage service, called Shared Access Signature. Management personnel can apply the Shared Access Signature to generate a temporary data access request for other users, and the temporary data access request covers effective digital signatures, and can thus pass the data verification. It also includes information about which information users can access and the operation limits and so on. At the same time, it will be effective only during the appointed time. In this way, the administrator can not only allow other users to access data, but also do so without leaking the access key.

question: What is the difference between the Azure SQL Database and the traditional SQL Server Database?
answer: Sometimes, the SQL Server and Azure SQL Database handle the same application working load. While one is a traditional database server applying the software licensing model, the other one is the service-mode cloud database, which is running in the data center of 21Vianet, and is available as a pay-as-you-go model or a commitment rate model. You can easily choose the platform and business model most suitable to your technological requirements through these two products. For more details, please refer to the SQL Azure web page.

question: How is Azure’s data redundancy guaranteed?
answer: We provide geo-redundancy. One dedicated line will be used to connect the two data centers in Beijing and Shanghai, China, and is dedicated to data synchronization between data centers. In terms of the data storage, Azure provides four redundant levels for storage: For details on Azure Redundant Storage, please refer to Introduction to Azure Storage and Pricing Details.

question: Are all data stored in Azure encrypted?
answer: Regarding data encryption, Azure provides all kinds of encryption functions including AES-256, Allowing customers to choose the best solutions for their requirements.

question: What certifications concerning cloud and data security has the Azure obtained in China?
answer: Azure has obtained the following certifications concerning cloud and data security in China: The 21Vianet promise to perform the authentication in accordance with the ISO/IEC 27001:2005 (this is a wide range of international information security standards). And the ISO/IEC 27001:2005C Certificate has confirmed that 21Vianet has carried out information security control measures, which is defined in the Standard and recognized internationally, including guidelines and general principles for starting, implementing, maintaining, and improving information security management of organizations. ISO scope: the Information Security Management System (ISMS), covering operations, security and management of commercial procedures. The certificate is openly issued by the CESI Certification Co., Ltd. (CESI). 21Vianet has adopted Azure’s leading technology, and with its strong localization operation capabilities, open platform, and high-quality SLA (Service Level Agreement), strong data recovery ability and the best customer benefits, the company was successfully certified in the first batch of trusted Cloud Services for Virtual Machines and Storage services. The Trust Cloud certification is the quality assessment system of the Cloud Services directed by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology of the People’s Republic of China and organized and implemented by the Cloud Computing Development and Policy Forum - the “Trust Cloud Group”. Certification aims to cultivate the domestic public cloud service market, enhance user confidence in Cloud Services, protect the formal cloud service providers, and promote the sound development of the market. Scope: the following functions are in the current auditing scope: Virtual Machines and Cloud Storage, accepting the assessment of 16 indicators in three large categories: data management, business quality, and rights guarantees in the SLA framework. Among which, in terms of the stability of operation, Microsoft Azure virtual cloud hosting and cloud storage services provided by 21Vianet has achieved a 99.9% SLA guarantee.
